analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are of the nature of blue, etc., and of the bloated, etc.

original: 'di gnyis ni grangs ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po nyid dag gi 'dod chags gnyis kyi gnyen po yin pas bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni grangs ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po nyid dag gi 'dod chags gnyis kyi gnyen po yin pas bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dag yin no //
translated: These two are the antidotes to the two attachments to form and the formless realms, respectively.

original: sa gzhan la sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas gnas pa zhes bya ba gsum pa sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa ni bsam gtan bzhi la yod pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhan la sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas gnas pa zhes bya ba gsum pa sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa ni bsam gtan bzhi la yod pa'o //
translated: The third liberation is the beautiful liberation. It is the fourth meditation.

original: de yang ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi mi sdug pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi mi sdug pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not by nature unattractive,

original: sdug pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the aspect of beauty.

original: rnam par thar pa bzhi pa ni gzugs med pa yin no /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bzhi pa ni gzugs med pa yin no /
translated: The fourth liberation is the formless realm.üîΩThe formless realm is the four formless meditative attainments.üîΩThe formless realm is called liberation because it is virtuous and equipoise alone, not like the afflicted states of the death state, etc.,

original: gzugs med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa dag kyang dge ba mnyam par gzhag pa kho na nyid yin gyi 'chi ba'i srid pa la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin pas mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang ma
analyzed: gzugs med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa dag kyang dge ba mnyam par gzhag pa kho na nyid yin gyi 'chi ba'i srid pa la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin pas mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang ma
translated: and it is not non-equipoise.

original: yin no // 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni rnam par thar pa brgyad yin te 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes dang tshor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin no // 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni rnam par thar pa brgyad yin te 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes dang tshor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cessation of discernment and feeling is the eighth liberation, because the meditative attainment of cessation is the turning away from discernment and feeling.

original: de ltar rnam par thar pa brgyad po rnams kyis rnam par dag pas na lha rdzas ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes @14a * //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par thar pa brgyad po rnams kyis rnam par dag pas na lha rdzas ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes @14a * //
translated: Thus, since the eight liberations are pure, they are beautified by eight divine pillars.

original: pa ste / 'khor lo la sogs pa'i ka ba brgyad po de dag gis mdzes par byas shing rnam par brgyan pa mtho ris kyi'ang 'dra bas na lha rdzas so //
analyzed: pa ste / 'khor lo la sogs pa'i ka ba brgyad po de dag gis mdzes par byas shing rnam par brgyan pa mtho ris kyi'ang 'dra bas na lha rdzas so //
translated: It is divine because it is like that of the higher realms.

original: rdo rje'i tshul ni sngags kyi tshul te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshul ni sngags kyi tshul te /
translated: The vajra way is the way of mantra.

original: de'i sgo nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir na rdo rje'i thig ste rdo rje'i phreng ba dang yang dag par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir na rdo rje'i thig ste rdo rje'i phreng ba dang yang dag par ldan pa yin no //
translated: Since the wheel of Dharma is turned by means of that, it is the vajra line, which is endowed with the vajra garland.

original: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The five sense objects, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ro dang / dri dang / reg bya dang / sgra rnams bzung ngo //üîΩyul de dag nyid ni tshu rol mthong ba'i mthong ba la bltas nas de kho nar yul gyi ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir de rnams dag pa ste ;
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ro dang / dri dang / reg bya dang / sgra rnams bzung ngo // yul de dag nyid ni tshu rol mthong ba'i mthong ba la bltas nas de kho nar yul gyi ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir de rnams dag pa ste ;
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes taste, smell, touch, and sound.üîΩSince those very sense objects are seen by the seeing of one who sees only the near side, they are pure,üîΩthat is, free from the nature of being the entity of the object as it is.

original: rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yin pa'i rgyu des na 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po bla na med pa de bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yin pa'i rgyu des na 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po bla na med pa de bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: For that reason, the five sense objects are the unsurpassed, inconceivable nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: mtha' yas pa ste de lta bu gang la yod kyang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa ste de lta bu gang la yod kyang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: it is infinite, and that which has such a nature is so-called.

original: rnam dag ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rnam dag ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Pure means the nature of the extremely pure dharmadhatu.

original: dam pa'i chos ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The holy Dharma is the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: de dag gi dbyings ni rigs te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de dag gi dbyings ni rigs te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sems so //
translated: The realm of those is the lineage, the mind of the perfection of wisdom.

original: mchod pa lnga ni me tog dang / bdug pa dang mar me dang / dri dang lha bshos kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: mchod pa lnga ni me tog dang / bdug pa dang mar me dang / dri dang lha bshos kyi rang bzhin te /

analyzed: de dag gis rnam par brgyan pa yang de yin la rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa yang yin no //

original: 'dab ma sna tshogs pa ste 'dab ma kha dog du ma can gyi padma dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul du ji ltar rigs pa bzhin gnas pa'i nyi ma dang zla ba de dag gis lha bcu dgu po rnams kyis gnas pa rnams yongs su bzung zhing byin gyis brlabs pa gang na yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

translated: The various petals, i.e., the lotus with many colored petals, and the sun and moon, as will be explained, in whatever way is appropriate, are the supports of the nineteen gods, and are the objects of the consecration.

original: khang pa brtsegs ma rin chen ma lus pa ste ma rgad dang padma r'a ga la sogs pa rnams kyis ji ltar mdzes par rnam par spras par rab tu bsgom par bya zhing bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs ma rin chen ma lus pa ste ma rgad dang padma r'a ga la sogs pa rnams kyis ji ltar mdzes par rnam par spras par rab tu bsgom par bya zhing bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should meditate on the palace, which is adorned with all the jewels, such as the lapis lazuli, the ruby, etc., in whatever way is pleasing.

analyzed: dbu ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o / bcu drug gi cha can ni aa la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams so //

original: @14b tshogs ni ka la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: @14b tshogs ni ka la sogs pa rnams so //

analyzed: de dag dang de dag las skyes shing byung ba gang yin pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

original: rigs kyis gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: rigs kyis gcig gi tshig go //

analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin shes rab dang thabs mtshon par byed pa'i zung gnyis zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that the two pairs illustrate wisdom and method, respectively.

original: / zla ba gnyis po 'di ni dpag tu med pa'i 'od kyi tshogs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: / zla ba gnyis po 'di ni dpag tu med pa'i 'od kyi tshogs dang ldan pa yin no //

original: dbu ma'i gdan dbus su bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i gdan dbus su bsam par bya'o //

original: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don 'di yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúAccording to the rite‚Äù means the following.

analyzed: yi ge aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
translated: The letter A is the door of all dharmas,

original: gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir na /

analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag 'gog pa'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi rang bzhin can de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin sems can mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus su nye bar 'gro bar khas blangs shing dam bcas pa ye shes bskul ba'i don du 'jig rten gyi khams
translated: The nature of the tathƒÅgatas, which is the nature of wisdom that is the essence of the negation of all things, is accepted and promised to approach the time of the complete enlightenment of sentient beings.üîΩThe purpose of the invocation of gnosis is the syllables such as a that come from the world systems of the kƒÅka·πá·∏çiya realm and become the sun.

analyzed: k'a kan di can nas byon pa'i aa la sogs pa nyi rim du gyur pa rnams yongs su gyur pa ni smon pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi ngo bo skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi zla ba

original: dang po yin no //

analyzed: de'i steng du snying rje'i bdag nyid can thabs kyi rang bzhin can de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo de kho na bzhin byon pa /

translated: The two moon-discs are the nature of mind, which is engaged by the consonants ya ra la va da dha bha, and so on, and the nature of the eighty minor marks of excellence.

analyzed: zla ba gnyis po 'di ni thogs pa dang dri ma dag dang bral bas bsal ba yin pa'i me long lta bu'i mtshon par byed pa yin la /

analyzed: gcig tu gyur pas ni mnyam pa nyid mtshon par byed pa yin no //

translated: are the nature of the two intuitions, mirror-like and sameness.üîΩThe two moon-discs are the nature of the mirror-like intuition and the sameness intuition.üîΩThe two moon-discs are the nature of the two intuitions, mirror-like and sameness.

original: de'i steng du rdo rje mchog bsgoms nas de'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas rgyal ba skyed byed @15a * //
analyzed: de'i steng du rdo rje mchog bsgoms nas de'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas rgyal ba skyed byed @15a * //
translated: In addition, you meditate on the supreme vajra and with that pride you generate the victor.üîΩ

original: skur bdag nyid blta zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: skur bdag nyid blta zhes 'brel te /
translated: Having meditated on the supreme vajra, with the pride of that, one should see oneself as the victor-producing body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin yin pas mchog kyang yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin yin pas mchog kyang yin la /
translated: The supreme is also the first, since it is the nature of the complete enlightenment of all the transcendent lords.

analyzed: thams cad kyi rgyu yin pas dang po yang yin pa ni dang po mchog ste rdo rje 'chad do //
translated: The supreme vajra is the first, since it is the cause of all.

original: de'i snying po ni sa bon te yi ge h'um ngo ;
analyzed: de'i snying po ni sa bon te yi ge h'um ngo ;
translated: Its essence is the seed, the syllable hum.

original: / de las byung zhing skyes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩnor bu dmar 'dra zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / de las byung zhing skyes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o // nor bu dmar 'dra zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One who has arisen from that, who has been born from that, is so called.üîΩRed like a ruby

original: padma r'a ga dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: padma r'a ga dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: means like a ruby.

original: thub dbang dpag tu med cing grangs med pa 'phro bzhin pa rnams kyi 'od zer rnams kyis mtha' yas pa'i phyogs kyi sgo kun nas yongs su khyab par byed pa dang / mchog snying po rdo rje sems dpa'i sa bon des mgon dang bcas shing byin gyis brlabs pa ste /

translated: And by that seed of the essence of the supreme Vajrasattva, the hero is empowered and blessed.

analyzed: yi ge h'um gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i lte bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the center empowered by the syllable hum, is the meaning.

original: de'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni 'di yang bya rog gi mig gi tshul gyis 'brel par bya ste /üîΩde lta bu'i rdo rje bsgoms nas aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni 'di yang bya rog gi mig gi tshul gyis 'brel par bya ste / de lta bu'i rdo rje bsgoms nas aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Endowed with that pride, means that this also is to be connected in the manner of the crow's eye.

original: zhes rdo rje'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i sngags pas bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes rdo rje'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i sngags pas bya ba yin no //
translated: Having meditated on that vajra, the mantrin endowed with the pride of the vajra, with the mantra Om vajra-atmako 'ham,üîΩshould perform the actions.

original: 'dis so sor rtog pa'i ye shes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis so sor rtog pa'i ye shes bstan to //

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnam pa can mtha' yas pa'i sprul pa spro ba rnams kyis 'gro don mchog sangs rgyas nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gang gis bsgrubs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

translated: It is so called because it accomplishes the supreme benefit of beings by means of emanations having the aspects of Vairochana and so on.

original: de'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas bsams nas ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas bsams nas ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having contemplated with the pride of that meansüîΩwith the pride of that, which is the pride of being a Tathagata.

translated: This is saying that the Tathagatas who are born from the letter hum, having made sentient beings into Tathagatas, gather inside.

original: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a aa ham /
analyzed: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a aa ham /

original: de 'dra ba'i lhag par mos par byas nas rdo rje 'chang du byas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nang du 'dus pa na zla ba dang rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las rgyal ba skyed byed skur blta'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i lhag par mos par byas nas rdo rje 'chang du byas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nang du 'dus pa na zla ba dang rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las rgyal ba skyed byed skur blta'o //

translated: Because it is nonconceptual, like the aspect of blue, etc., the apprehended object and apprehending subject or the generality of blue do not appear in the self-cognizing cognition.

analyzed: sngon po rtogs pa po gzhan gyis ba lta bar bya ba nyid ni mngon sum gyis rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The otherness of the cognizer of blue is not cognized by direct perception,

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa yang mngon sum nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa yang mngon sum nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were, then the cognition of another would be direct perception.

original: spu langs pa la sogs pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: spu langs pa la sogs pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not cognized by inference arising from a reason such as bodily movement,

original: de'i yul ni spyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni spyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of that is a generality.

original: des na thun mong ma yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dus gcig tu rtogs pa ni shes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: des na thun mong ma yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dus gcig tu rtogs pa ni shes pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the uncommon form, etc., simultaneously is only consciousness,

original: yul rung bas na gnas pas ma shes pa rang gi shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rung bas na gnas pas ma shes pa rang gi shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cognition of itself, which is the nonapprehension of the object that is suitable to appear.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don ni skad @30b cig ma yin pa yan lag can la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gcig pa kho na ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la brjod pa ni dkar po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don ni skad @30b cig ma yin pa yan lag can la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gcig pa kho na ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la brjod pa ni dkar po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The author replies: White, etc.

original: dkar po la sogs pa ste gzugs dkar ba la sogs pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa ste gzugs dkar ba la sogs pa mthong ba ste /
translated: White, etc., refers to the perception of white, etc., form.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid ni des gzhan snga ma'am phyi ma dag tu mthong ba med do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid ni des gzhan snga ma'am phyi ma dag tu mthong ba med do //
translated: That which is directly perceived is not seen again later by that same perception.

original: snga phyi stong pa nyid mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga phyi stong pa nyid mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the former and latter are seen to be empty.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa mthong zin pa dang / mthong ba'am mthong bzhin pa dang mthong bar 'gyur ba 'di dag ni rtag tu phan tshun du gcig la gcig bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa mthong zin pa dang / mthong ba'am mthong bzhin pa dang mthong bar 'gyur ba 'di dag ni rtag tu phan tshun du gcig la gcig bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is stated: that which has been seen, that which is being seen, and that which will be seen are always mutually exclusive, like pleasure and pain.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar gnas pa da ltar ba tsam 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar gnas pa da ltar ba tsam 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
translated: The eye consciousness, etc., only apprehend the present, which is near.

original: de lta ma yin na thag ring ba dang bar chod pa la sogs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / byis ba dang / rgan pa la sogs pa yang cig car 'dzin par thal ba bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thag ring ba dang bar chod pa la sogs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / byis ba dang / rgan pa la sogs pa yang cig car 'dzin par thal ba bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would be difficult to avoid the consequence that one would apprehend at one time what is distant, what is obstructed, what is past, what is future, what is young, what is old, and so on.

original: de ltar 'di yan chad kyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa sgrub pa'i tshad ma bkag pas bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar 'di yan chad kyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa sgrub pa'i tshad ma bkag pas bstan to //
translated: Up to this point, the demonstration of the refutation of the validating cognitions which establish the grasped and the grasper has been presented.

original: da ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma las don rnams med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam ston pas brjod pa ni thog ma tha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma las don rnams med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam ston pas brjod pa ni thog ma tha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate mere representation by the fact that objects do not exist because of the invalidating cognitions, he says: ‚ÄúThe beginning and end, etc.‚Äù

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: phyi rol gyi don ni yon tan dang rdzas la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa mang pos pha rol po rnams kyis brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni yon tan dang rdzas la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa mang pos pha rol po rnams kyis brtags pa yin no //
translated: The external object is imagined by others to be manifold by way of the divisions of quality, substance, etc.

original: de la yon tan la sogs pa chos rnams kyi rten ni rdzas yin pas de bkag pa'i rdzas de dag rtsa ba dang bcas pa du ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de la yon tan la sogs pa chos rnams kyi rten ni rdzas yin pas de bkag pa'i rdzas de dag rtsa ba dang bcas pa du ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Since substance is the substratum of qualities, etc., many substances with their roots will arise, since you have refuted substance.

original: / des na logs su su na 'byin pa ma brjod de //
analyzed: / des na logs su su na 'byin pa ma brjod de //
translated: Therefore, we do not state a separate refutation of it.

original: du ma yang 'du ba can med par ma yin pa des na de'i lugs su sun 'byin pa mi brjod do //
analyzed: du ma yang 'du ba can med par ma yin pa des na de'i lugs su sun 'byin pa mi brjod do //
translated: Since many are not without an aggregate, we do not state a refutation of its system.

original: rdzas kyang sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / yid ces bya ba rnam pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: rdzas kyang sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / yid ces bya ba rnam pa dgu yin no //
translated: Substance is of nine kinds: earth, water, fire, air, space, time, direction, self, and mind.

original: de la bdag ni de ma thag tu bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdag ni de ma thag tu bsam par bya'o //
translated: Of these, the self will be considered immediately below.

original: sgra yang nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan can du 'dod do //
analyzed: sgra yang nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan can du 'dod do //
translated: Sound is held to be a quality of space.

original: de yang ci yin pas mtshungs pa'i phyir na sgra thams cad tha dad par thos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang ci yin pas mtshungs pa'i phyir na sgra thams cad tha dad par thos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is the same in all, all sounds would not be heard distinctly.

original: des na rang dang nye ba'i yul bzhin du bar chod pa'i yul du mngon par @31a * //
analyzed: des na rang dang nye ba'i yul bzhin du bar chod pa'i yul du mngon par @31a * //
translated: Therefore, like a sound that is near or far, a sound that is obstructed would be perceived.

original: 'dod par yang sgra grags pa thos par 'gyur ba'am gzhan du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gcig tu nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod par yang sgra grags pa thos par 'gyur ba'am gzhan du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gcig tu nges pa yin no //
translated: It is certain that the sound is heard only in the place where it is produced, and not elsewhere.

original: phyogs dang yul dag kyang gcig yin pa'i phyir na snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa'i rkyen du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phyogs dang yul dag kyang gcig yin pa'i phyir na snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa'i rkyen du mi 'thad do //
translated: And since the place and the direction are one, the conditions of prior and posterior are not tenable.

original: 'di snyam du rnam par dbye ba 'di ni khyad par du byed pa rnams tha dad pas yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du rnam par dbye ba 'di ni khyad par du byed pa rnams tha dad pas yin no //
translated: If you think that this distinction is due to the difference of the particularities,

original: ci khyad par du byed pa dag gi snga ma dang phyi ma rang las yin nam 'on te gzhan las yin /
analyzed: ci khyad par du byed pa dag gi snga ma dang phyi ma rang las yin nam 'on te gzhan las yin /
translated: are the prior and posterior particularities of the particularities themselves or of something else?

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar na de nyid las rtogs pa de grub pa'i phyir de dag don med do //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar na de nyid las rtogs pa de grub pa'i phyir de dag don med do //
translated: If the former, then the particularities are pointless, because the cognition of that is established by that alone.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang gal te phyogs dang yul dag kho na las yin na de ni de'i tshe gcig yin pa'i phyir na 'di nyid kyi tshe 'gyur ba de dag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang gal te phyogs dang yul dag kho na las yin na de ni de'i tshe gcig yin pa'i phyir na 'di nyid kyi tshe 'gyur ba de dag mi 'thad do //
translated: If the latter, then if the particularities are of the place and the direction, then they are one, and therefore the conditions of prior and posterior are not tenable.

original: gzhan yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are of something else,üîΩthen the particularities of the place and the direction are pointless.

original: de dag don med pa por 'jug go //üîΩnam mkha' dang phyogs dang yul 'di rnams ni rtag pa yin pas lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de dag don med pa por 'jug go // nam mkha' dang phyogs dang yul 'di rnams ni rtag pa yin pas lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: They engage in that which is meaningless.

original: de dang bral ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: de dang bral ba yang rung ste /
translated: Since space, direction, and location are permanent, they are either endowed with the activity of a co-originating cause or they are not.

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par ma thob par rang gi 'bras bu res 'ga' kho na skyed par byed par ji ltar 'gyur /üîΩ'di ltar / de dag nus pa'am nus med pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par ma thob par rang gi 'bras bu res 'ga' kho na skyed par byed par ji ltar 'gyur / 'di ltar / de dag nus pa'am nus med pa //
translated: If they are not endowed with the activity of a co-originating cause, how could they sometimes generate their own effect?üîΩThus:üîΩIf they are essentially powerless or powerful,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis gang gnas ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis gang gnas ni //
translated: and they remain so,

original: rtag pa nyid phyir gso min na //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid phyir gso min na //
translated: then they are not healed,

original: de zad bya phyir nus pa gang //
analyzed: de zad bya phyir nus pa gang //
translated: and what is the point of exhausting them?

original: zhes so // 'dis ni yid kyang bsal to //
analyzed: zhes so // 'dis ni yid kyang bsal to //
translated: This also refutes the mind.

original: yid smra ba rnams kyis yid 'di ni shes pa cig car mi skye ba las dpag par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: yid smra ba rnams kyis yid 'di ni shes pa cig car mi skye ba las dpag par bya ba yin na /
translated: The mind is inferred from the non-simultaneous arising of cognitions.

original: gar lta ba la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa cig car nyams su myong ba yin na /
analyzed: gar lta ba la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa cig car nyams su myong ba yin na /
translated: But when one sees and so forth, consciousnesses are experienced simultaneously.

original: de ltar yin na ni nam yang mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni nam yang mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would never be tenable.

original: des na nam mkha' la sogs pa ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na nam mkha' la sogs pa ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, space and so on are absolutely nonexistent.

original: sa la sogs pa lus pa yin na de yang yan lag can dang rdul phra rab kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su brtags so //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa lus pa yin na de yang yan lag can dang rdul phra rab kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su brtags so //
translated: If earth and so on remain, they are investigated as twofold, by way of the part-possessor and the subtle particle.

original: de la yan lag can yod pa ma yin la rdul phra rab kyang med de /
analyzed: de la yan lag can yod pa ma yin la rdul phra rab kyang med de /
translated: Therein, the part-possessor does not exist, nor do the subtle particles.

original: de gnyis ka la yang sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ka la yang sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no proof for either of them.

original: de nyid la gnod par byed pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjod par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la gnod par byed pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjod par byed pa ni /
translated: The refutation of them is stated in order,

original: thog ma tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: beginning with ‚ÄúIf the cloth is not woven, etc.‚Äù

original: snam bu la sogs pa dag ni rdul phra rab gnyis la sogs pas brtsams pa'i rim gyis brtsams pa yan lag can gyi rang bzhin du rab tu grags par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa dag ni rdul phra rab gnyis la sogs pas brtsams pa'i rim gyis brtsams pa yan lag can gyi rang bzhin du rab tu grags par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Cloth and so on are not well known to exist as part-possessors, since they are composed by way of a process beginning with two subtle particles and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la @31b sogs pa ni thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus la sogs pa'i dbye bas phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin rags pa gcig dang bral ba kho nar mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la @31b sogs pa ni thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus la sogs pa'i dbye bas phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin rags pa gcig dang bral ba kho nar mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the reason that form and so on are seen to be devoid of a single gross nature that is mutually contradictory by virtue of its division into beginning, end, middle, and so on.

original: de ltar 'dis ni shes pa gcig dang 'dres pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar 'dis ni shes pa gcig dang 'dres pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs brjod do //
translated: In this way, he states the reason of non-apprehension, which has the characteristic of the non-apprehension of an entity that has a nature mixed with a single cognition.

original: de lta de ltar gnas 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: de lta de ltar gnas 'gyur ba'i //
translated: In that case, only the changing parts

original: cha shas 'ba' zhig snang ba ste //
analyzed: cha shas 'ba' zhig snang ba ste //
translated: appear.

original: de dang ldan pa cha med pa //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa cha med pa //
translated: The possessor of those parts, which is partless,

original: gzhan ni snang ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan ni snang ba yod ma yin //
translated: is not seen to exist separately.

original: yan lag gcig kha bsgyur ram g-yon na'ang de la 'du ba'i yan lag can yang kha bsgyur ba'am g-yo ba mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag gcig kha bsgyur ram g-yon na'ang de la 'du ba'i yan lag can yang kha bsgyur ba'am g-yo ba mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one part is turned or moves, then the whole possessor of parts would be seen to be turned or moving.

original: 'on te yan lag kha bsgyur ba dang g-yo ba yin gyi yan lag can ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag kha bsgyur ba dang g-yo ba yin gyi yan lag can ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the parts are turned and move, but the possessor of parts is not,

original: 'on de kha bsgyur ba dang mi g-yo bar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on de kha bsgyur ba dang mi g-yo bar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is changed or not moved, it will be seen.

original: yan lag gcig bsgribs pa na yang de mi mthong ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag gcig bsgribs pa na yang de mi mthong ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one part is covered, it will not be seen at all.

original: de ma bsgribs na ni dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de ma bsgribs na ni dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: If it is not covered, it will be difficult to avoid the consequence that it is perceived.

original: / de ltar tha dad pa'i bdag nyid can 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir yan lag can gcig yin par mi 'os pas na 'di ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur ba'i dus la bab par mthong ngo //
analyzed: / de ltar tha dad pa'i bdag nyid can 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir yan lag can gcig yin par mi 'os pas na 'di ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur ba'i dus la bab par mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, because of the presence of contradictory properties, it is not suitable for the possessor of parts to be one. Therefore, it is seen that the time has come for it to be the object of the convention of nonexistence.

original: de ltar gcig bkag pas da ni du ma'i rang bzhin lus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gcig bkag pas da ni du ma'i rang bzhin lus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because of the refutation of one, now the remaining nature is that of plurality.

original: de yang du ma rnams kyis rnam pa du mar nye bar brtags te /
analyzed: de yang du ma rnams kyis rnam pa du mar nye bar brtags te /
translated: That is also imputed in many ways by the many.

original: dper na bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis dang po dngos su dbang po'i spyod yul yin pa dang / bye brag pa rnams kyis ni yan lag can rtsom par byed pa nyid dang / mdo sde pa rnams kyi sha za ltar rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa rang gi rnam par gtod pa nus pa yin no zhes rdul phra rab 'dod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis dang po dngos su dbang po'i spyod yul yin pa dang / bye brag pa rnams kyis ni yan lag can rtsom par byed pa nyid dang / mdo sde pa rnams kyi sha za ltar rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa rang gi rnam par gtod pa nus pa yin no zhes rdul phra rab 'dod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas assert that the atom is directly the domain of the sense faculty, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas that it is the cause of the origin of the whole, and the SautrƒÅntikas that it is the cause of the projection of its own form, which is always hidden, like the smell of a flower.

original: de la re zhig bye brag tu smra bas brtags pa'i rdul phra rab bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig bye brag tu smra bas brtags pa'i rdul phra rab bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: Of these, the following is stated in order to refute the atom as imagined by the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas:

original: phra rab rdul rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phra rab rdul rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe atoms do not touch each other.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rags pa gcig med pa de bzhin du du ma nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rags pa gcig med pa de bzhin du du ma nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the single gross object does not exist, so also the plurality does not exist.

original: gtan tshigs brjod pa ni phra rab rdul rnams mthong ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs brjod pa ni phra rab rdul rnams mthong ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is stated: ‚Äúbecause the atoms are not seen.‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin phan tshun tha dad pa ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin phan tshun tha dad pa ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the atoms, which are of the nature of being mutually different, are not perceived.

original: de ste rags pa gzhan du mi 'thad par rdul phra rab rjes su dbog go zhe na /
analyzed: de ste rags pa gzhan du mi 'thad par rdul phra rab rjes su dbog go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not tenable that the gross is different, and that the subtle is imputed in dependence on the gross,

original: brjod pa ni /
analyzed: brjod pa ni /
translated: we reply:

original: rdul phran cha med yin na zhes bya ba la @32a * //
analyzed: rdul phran cha med yin na zhes bya ba la @32a * //
translated: If the atom is partless, etc.

original: sogs pa'o // bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'o // bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: re zhig rdul phra rab rnams cha shas dang bcas par ni 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig rdul phra rab rnams cha shas dang bcas par ni 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: First, you should not maintain that the atoms have parts.

original: cig car 'gal ba'i yul ni gnas pa bcu po rnams dang drug gis sbyar ba la sogs pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas rags pa bzhin du du mar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car 'gal ba'i yul ni gnas pa bcu po rnams dang drug gis sbyar ba la sogs pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas rags pa bzhin du du mar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like the gross, they would be multiple, since they would be the loci of the ten directions and the six directions, which are mutually exclusive.

original: rdul phran cha med yin na ste /
analyzed: rdul phran cha med yin na ste /
translated: If the atom is partless,

original: yan lag gi mtshan nyid cha dang bral ba yin par gyur na du ma'i rdul phran du ma rnams kyis bskor ba ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi mtshan nyid cha dang bral ba yin par gyur na du ma'i rdul phran du ma rnams kyis bskor ba ste /
translated: if it has the characteristic of a partless component, then it would not be surrounded by many atoms,

original: du ma'i nang du bcug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ma'i nang du bcug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be situated among many.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab kyis bskor ba yin na steng dang 'og phyogs bzhi'i rdul phra rab kyi dbus na gnas pa de gdon mi za bar cha drug tu 'gyur te /üîΩ'di'i rang bzhin gang zhig rdul phra rab gzhan dang nye ba de nyid du rdul phra rab de las gzhan dang nye bar ni mi 'byor te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab kyis bskor ba yin na steng dang 'og phyogs bzhi'i rdul phra rab kyi dbus na gnas pa de gdon mi za bar cha drug tu 'gyur te / 'di'i rang bzhin gang zhig rdul phra rab gzhan dang nye ba de nyid du rdul phra rab de las gzhan dang nye bar ni mi 'byor te /
translated: If it is surrounded by other subtle particles, then the subtle particle located in the middle of the four directions and above and below is certainly divided into six parts.

analyzed: de dag yul gcig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: gal te de yang de na yod pa de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de yang de na yod pa de lta na /

analyzed: shar gyi rdul phra rab dang nye ba'i rang bzhin nyid nub kyi rdul phra rab dang nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //

original: nye bar gnas pa med pa na mngon du bltas pa tsam la yang nye ba 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa med pa na mngon du bltas pa tsam la yang nye ba 'di nyid yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir gong bu'i rang bzhin rdul phra rab tsam du thal ba'i phyir ro //

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs rang bzhin gyis /
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs rang bzhin gyis /
translated: The nature of the earth mandala and so on

analyzed: bsags pa 'ga' yang 'di la med par 'gyur //

original: ji skad du /üîΩ'byar ba dang ni bskor ba'am //
analyzed: ji skad du / 'byar ba dang ni bskor ba'am //
translated: As it is said:üîΩWhether they are joined or surrounding,

original: bar med rnam par gnas kyang rung //
analyzed: bar med rnam par gnas kyang rung //
translated: or are situated without interstice,

original: dbus gnas rdul phran rdul gcig la //
analyzed: dbus gnas rdul phran rdul gcig la //
translated: in the middle, the atom is one.

original: bltas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa //üîΩde nyid rdul phran gzhan dag la //
analyzed: bltas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa // de nyid rdul phran gzhan dag la //
translated: That which is the nature of the one

original: gal te bltas par rtogs byed na //üîΩde ltar yin nas 'dzin las //
analyzed: gal te bltas par rtogs byed na // de ltar yin nas 'dzin las //
translated: if it is understood as the nature of the other atoms,üîΩthen, being so, the coarse,

original: sogs pa'i rags pa mi 'thad do //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i rags pa mi 'thad do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: such as grasping, is not tenable.

original: gcig ma grub na du ma mi 'grub pa'i phyir rdul phra rab dag ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gcig ma grub na du ma mi 'grub pa'i phyir rdul phra rab dag ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: Since the many are not established if the one is not established, the atoms do not exist.

original: 'dis ni thun mong du sun phyung bas rdul phra rab tu smra ba rnams thams cad bsal ba'i phyir so sor sun phyung bsam gtan pa la thag pa gus par ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni thun mong du sun phyung bas rdul phra rab tu smra ba rnams thams cad bsal ba'i phyir so sor sun phyung bsam gtan pa la thag pa gus par ma byas so //
translated: Since this refutes them in common, it refutes all atomists. Therefore, the author of the commentary did not respect the rope of meditation.

original: 'di yan chad kyis ni sgrub byed kyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang gnod byed kyi tshad ma yod pa'i phyir phyi'i don ni med do zhes bstan nas da ni 'gro ba ma lus pa 'di rnam par rig pa tsam kho na'o zhes nye bar sdud par byedüîΩpas / des @32b na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di yan chad kyis ni sgrub byed kyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang gnod byed kyi tshad ma yod pa'i phyir phyi'i don ni med do zhes bstan nas da ni 'gro ba ma lus pa 'di rnam par rig pa tsam kho na'o zhes nye bar sdud par byed pas / des @32b na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Up to this point, it has been shown that external objects do not exist because there is no valid knowledge to prove that they exist and because there is valid knowledge that contradicts that they exist. Now, in order to summarize that all these beings are only consciousness, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, all this is consciousness only.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba brjod ma thag pa'i rigs pa'i mthus 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir rang rgyud kyi gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir rang bzhin can gyi rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad ni phyi rol gyi don dang
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba brjod ma thag pa'i rigs pa'i mthus 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir rang rgyud kyi gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir rang bzhin can gyi rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad ni phyi rol gyi don dang
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means that by the power of the reasoning just expressed, because they are free from the grasped and the grasper, all things, moving and unmoving, which are the objects of the consciousness that perceives form and so on, are devoid of external objects.

original: bral bas rang gi bag chags tsam las byung ba nyid kyis dri za'i grong khyer lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bral bas rang gi bag chags tsam las byung ba nyid kyis dri za'i grong khyer lta bu yin no //
translated: Because they arise from one‚Äôs own latent propensities alone, they are like a city of gandharvas.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam yin mod de la snga ma bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du mi bzod pas na nam mkha'i padma bzhin du yod pa'i tha snyad du bya bar mi 'os so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam yin mod de la snga ma bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du mi bzod pas na nam mkha'i padma bzhin du yod pa'i tha snyad du bya bar mi 'os so //
translated: Since consciousness is not capable of being either one or many, as previously explained, it is not suitable to be the object of the convention ‚Äúexists,‚Äù like a sky flower.

original: yod pa'i dngos po la ni rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir des ni gcig dang du ma dag las gang yang rung ba gcig 'gyur dgos na de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po la ni rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir des ni gcig dang du ma dag las gang yang rung ba gcig 'gyur dgos na de lta ma yin no //
translated: Because an existent thing cannot be otherwise, it must be either one or many. But it is not like that.

original: des na 'di ji ltar yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur zhes bya ba mi shes so //
analyzed: des na 'di ji ltar yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur zhes bya ba mi shes so //
translated: So how can it be the object of the convention ‚Äúexists‚Äù?

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa la ni gcig dang du ma dang mi ldan pa nyid mi srid do zhes bya bar sems na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa la ni gcig dang du ma dang mi ldan pa nyid mi srid do zhes bya bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that it is impossible for consciousness to be neither one nor many,

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: shes pa rnams dang bcas pa la ni phyi rol bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rnams dang bcas pa la ni phyi rol bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like external things, it is refuted as being devoid of the nature of being either one or many.

original: gang yang 'jig rten gyis phyi rol gyi don du tha snyad byas pa de nyid rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten gyis phyi rol gyi don du tha snyad byas pa de nyid rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba'i shes pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is conventionally designated as an external object by the world is a cognition that is said to have an aspect.

original: des na phyi rol gyi don yin pa la gnod pa gang yin pa de nyid ni nang gi dngos po yin pa la yang gnod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi don yin pa la gnod pa gang yin pa de nyid ni nang gi dngos po yin pa la yang gnod pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever is a fault in the case of external objects is also a fault in the case of internal things.

original: 'di ltar gnod pas ni rags pa gcig gam rdul phra rab ma yin pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnod pas ni rags pa gcig gam rdul phra rab ma yin pa sel bar byed do //
translated: In this way, the fault refutes a coarse whole or a subtle part.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rnam pa 'di yang gal te rags pa gcig yin nam /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rnam pa 'di yang gal te rags pa gcig yin nam /
translated: This aspect that is of the nature of cognition, moreover, is either a coarse whole or many different subtle parts.

original: gal te rdul phra rab mang po tha dad pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab mang po tha dad pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is a coarse whole or many different subtle parts,

original: gnyi ga ltar yang phyi rol gyi don la 'byung ba'i sun 'byin pa spangs par mi nus so //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang phyi rol gyi don la 'byung ba'i sun 'byin pa spangs par mi nus so //
translated: in both cases, it is not possible to avoid the refutation that applies to external objects.

original: gang gis de med pas med par 'gyur ba de rnam par shes pa las phyi rol yin pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sun 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de med pas med par 'gyur ba de rnam par shes pa las phyi rol yin pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sun 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason that it does not exist when that does not exist is not a refutation on the grounds that it is external to consciousness.

original: lus can gyi rgyu mtshan gyis gnod par byed pa ni lus can ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang snying po med de /
analyzed: lus can gyi rgyu mtshan gyis gnod par byed pa ni lus can ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang snying po med de /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the body is harmed by the body, but that the non-body, the nature of consciousness, is not harmed.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid yin na rnam par shes pa yang lus can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid yin na rnam par shes pa yang lus can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is the consciousness of blue, etc., then consciousness itself has a body.

original: yul khyab par byed pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa 'di nyid lus can yin la de ni 'di la yod @33a * //üîΩpa kho na'o //
analyzed: yul khyab par byed pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa 'di nyid lus can yin la de ni 'di la yod @33a * // pa kho na'o //
translated: This very form that pervades the object has a body, and it exists in consciousness.

original: bde ba la sogs pa gsal ba bsnyon par mi nus pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa gsal ba bsnyon par mi nus pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the manifestation of pleasure, etc., cannot be denied.

original: 'di ltar dub pa'i lus ji srid chu bur zhugs pa de srid du khyab pa'i bde ba skye bar nyams su myong ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dub pa'i lus ji srid chu bur zhugs pa de srid du khyab pa'i bde ba skye bar nyams su myong ba yin la /
translated: Thus, as long as the body is tired, the arising of pervasive pleasure is experienced.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni yul khyab pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni yul khyab pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: That which is like that is not an object that does not pervade,

original: lus kyang de ltar yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyang de ltar yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that the body is also like that.

original: yul khyab par byed pa yin na lus bzhin du de las lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul khyab par byed pa yin na lus bzhin du de las lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it pervades the object, then like the body, it would have parts because of the presence of the object.

original: des na rnam pa gzhan du rnam par shes pa rnam pa med pa yang phyi rol gyi don gyi sun dbyung ba las ma 'das pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis logs shig tu sun dbyung ba lhur ma byas so zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na rnam pa gzhan du rnam par shes pa rnam pa med pa yang phyi rol gyi don gyi sun dbyung ba las ma 'das pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis logs shig tu sun dbyung ba lhur ma byas so zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the Master did not make a special effort to refute consciousness without aspects, because it is not beyond the refutation of external objects.

original: des na rnam par shes pa de yang yod pa'i tha snyad du bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa de yang yod pa'i tha snyad du bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the position: that consciousness also should not be conventionally designated as existent.

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa dang shes bya dag med pa'i phyir med pa'i rang bzhin de kho na yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa dang shes bya dag med pa'i phyir med pa'i rang bzhin de kho na yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, since consciousness and objects of consciousness do not exist, thatness is the nature of nonexistence.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: rnam par shes pa de kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
translated: That consciousness exists conventionally.

original: kun rdzob ni bsnyon par mi nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni bsnyon par mi nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conventional cannot be denied.

original: yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir med pa nyid nan gyis byung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir med pa nyid nan gyis byung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: If existence is refuted, nonexistence is affirmed.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: med pa nyid ni yod pa nyid sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas de ma grub na de yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid ni yod pa nyid sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas de ma grub na de yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because nonexistence is preceded by existence. If the latter is not established, the former is not established.

original: ji skad du /üîΩmed pa yod pa'i zlas drangs te //
analyzed: ji skad du / med pa yod pa'i zlas drangs te //
translated: As it is said:üîΩNonexistence is elicited by existence,

original: yod pa med pa'i zlas drangs yin //
analyzed: yod pa med pa'i zlas drangs yin //
translated: existence is elicited by nonexistence.

original: de phyir med pa mi brjod na //
analyzed: de phyir med pa mi brjod na //
translated: Therefore, if nonexistence is not expressed,

original: yod pa nyid du mi rtag go //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du mi rtag go // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: existence is not ascertained.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the nature of both existence and nonexistence,

original: yod pa dang med pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence and nonexistence are contradictory.

original: yod pa med pa dag las gzhan gnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa med pa dag las gzhan gnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a nature that is neither of those, different from existence and nonexistence,

original: gzhi gang la phyi rol du gyur pa gzhan ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi gang la phyi rol du gyur pa gzhan ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that there is anything external to a basis.

original: 'o na ni de kho na nyid 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de kho na nyid 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, it would follow that nothing at all exists in reality.

original: 'di nyid de kho na nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di nyid de kho na nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this itself reality?

original: 'di lta ste de kho na nyid dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste de kho na nyid dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúfree from reality.‚Äù

original: des na mtha' bzhi las nges par grol ba'i rnam par shes pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na mtha' bzhi las nges par grol ba'i rnam par shes pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is liberated from the four extremes, and because of appearance.

original: de kho nar de kho na med pa nyid de kho na rig pa'i de kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho nar de kho na med pa nyid de kho na rig pa'i de kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the point: the nonexistence of reality in reality is the reality of the knowledge of reality.

original: gal te de ltar yin na de'i tshe rtag tu rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'khor ba yin /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na de'i tshe rtag tu rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'khor ba yin /
translated: If this is so, then how can there be cyclic existence, since it would be permanent at all times?üîΩAnd how can there be purification, since it would not exist?

original: de med pa'i phyir @33b rnam par byang ba yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir @33b rnam par byang ba yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa la brjod pa ni /
translated: To respond to this qualm, he says:

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩmtha' bzhi dang bral ba'i sems 'di nyid la bdag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun gyi ngo bos ni 'khor ba'i rnam pa yin la bdag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa las bzlog pa la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin tsam gyis mthar thug
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // mtha' bzhi dang bral ba'i sems 'di nyid la bdag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun gyi ngo bos ni 'khor ba'i rnam pa yin la bdag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa las bzlog pa la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin tsam gyis mthar thug
translated: In this regard,üîΩIn this very mind free from the four extremes, the aspect of cyclic existence is the nature of the continuum of conceptual thoughts that superimpose a self and so on.

original: par rnam par shes pas ni rnam par dag pa ste thar pa yin no //
analyzed: par rnam par shes pas ni rnam par dag pa ste thar pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of purification, or liberation, is the knowledge that the nature of the self and so on is merely an absence of self.

original: 'dir rtog pa sbyang ba la 'bad par bya'o zhes kyang gsungs ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rtog pa sbyang ba la 'bad par bya'o zhes kyang gsungs ba yin no //
translated: Here, one should strive to purify thoughts.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don du lhag par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir srid pa dang rjes su mthun pas tha mal pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don du lhag par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir srid pa dang rjes su mthun pas tha mal pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since the conceptualization that is attached to external objects is erroneous, it is ordinary because it is in accord with existence.

original: gang gi rang bzhin tsam la gnas pa nyid kyis rtog pa med cing ma 'khrul pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin tsam la gnas pa nyid kyis rtog pa med cing ma 'khrul pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The nature of direct perception is pure because it is nonconceptual and nonerroneous by merely abiding in its nature.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: don la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir //üîΩrtog pa'ang rang rig la mi 'dod //
analyzed: don la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir // rtog pa'ang rang rig la mi 'dod //
translated: Because of conceptualization of objects,

original: ces gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: conceptualization is not accepted in self-awareness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yang rang gi rang bzhin la rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yang rang gi rang bzhin la rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since conceptualization is nonconceptual with regard to its own nature, all phenomena are intrinsically pure.

original: de nyid gsungs pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is stated as follows:üîΩHere, in this world, the nature of the mind is luminous.

original: de nyid kyi phyi slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyi slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: Also, the master Nagarjuna, his later disciple, said:

original: mya ngan 'das dang srid pa nyid //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das dang srid pa nyid //
translated: Nirvana and cyclic existence

original: gnyis po 'di ni yod min te //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ni yod min te //
translated: Are not the slightest bit different.

original: srid pa yongs su shes pa nyid //
analyzed: srid pa yongs su shes pa nyid //
translated: Complete knowledge of cyclic existence

original: mya ngan 'das pa yin par brjod //üîΩmya ngan 'das pa 'khor ba las //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa yin par brjod // mya ngan 'das pa 'khor ba las //
translated: Is said to be nirvana.üîΩNirvana is not the slightest bit

original: khyad par cung zad yod min te //üîΩ'khor ba mya ngan 'das pa las //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod min te // 'khor ba mya ngan 'das pa las //
translated: Different from cyclic existence.üîΩCyclic existence is not the slightest bit

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Different from nirvana.

original: 'o na te gal te de nyid du srid pa dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin dag la dbye ba med na 'o na ji ltar /
analyzed: 'o na te gal te de nyid du srid pa dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin dag la dbye ba med na 'o na ji ltar /
translated: If the nature of cyclic existence and nirvana are not different in reality, then how could it be said:

original: gang phyir gzugs sogs rnam pa dang bral ba //üîΩthams cad la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir gzugs sogs rnam pa dang bral ba // thams cad la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa'o //
translated: Since form and so on are devoid of aspects,üîΩAll is said to be empty.

original: thams cad kyi sgra ni don du ma'i yul can yin no zhes grag go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra ni don du ma'i yul can yin no zhes grag go //
translated: It is well known that the word ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to many objects.

original: de yang tha dad pa med na sbyor bar 'os pa ma yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa med na sbyor bar 'os pa ma yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: If there is no difference, it is not suitable to apply the word ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: thams cad nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEverything‚Äù and so on.

original: kun rdzob tu ni zhi ba dang srid pa la sogs pa tha dad pa yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni zhi ba dang srid pa la sogs pa tha dad pa yod pa kho na ste /
translated: In the relative, there is indeed a difference between peace and existence and so on.

original: des na kun rdzob pa'i dngos po snang ba rang @34a * //
analyzed: des na kun rdzob pa'i dngos po snang ba rang @34a * //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of relative things is

original: bzhin gyis kun du rtog pa gang yin pa de las gzhan pa'i thams cad ces bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te thams cad kyi sgra ni rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: bzhin gyis kun du rtog pa gang yin pa de las gzhan pa'i thams cad ces bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te thams cad kyi sgra ni rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i yul can yin no //
translated: imagined by nature. Apart from that, there is no so-called ‚Äúeverything.‚Äù The word ‚Äúeverything‚Äù is the domain of conceptual superimposition.

original: des na de lta bur gyur pa thams cad la de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i tha dad pa'i don bden pa yin na bdag med pa bdag med pas srid pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de lta bur gyur pa thams cad la de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i tha dad pa'i don bden pa yin na bdag med pa bdag med pas srid pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, if all that exists in that way has a different meaning that is endowed with reality, since selflessness is selfless, existence would exist.

original: srid pa dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin rnams ji ltar tha dad pa med pa yin zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: srid pa dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin rnams ji ltar tha dad pa med pa yin zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: How could the natures of existence and peace be undifferentiated? That is not so.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The view of self is twofold:

original: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //üîΩde la lus la sogs pas tha dad pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byed pa po dang / de'i 'bras bu spyod pa po rtag pa dang khyab pa ni bdag yin no zhes bdag tu mngon par smra ba gzeg zan pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa goms pas nye bar bskyed pa 'du byed las byung ba ni mngon par 'du byed las byung
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o // de la lus la sogs pas tha dad pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byed pa po dang / de'i 'bras bu spyod pa po rtag pa dang khyab pa ni bdag yin no zhes bdag tu mngon par smra ba gzeg zan pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa goms pas nye bar bskyed pa 'du byed las byung ba ni mngon par 'du byed las byung
translated: It is produced by the formative forces and it is innate.

original: pa ste ; bye brag pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ste ; bye brag pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The self is the permanent and pervasive agent of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, which are distinguished by the body and so on, and it is the experiencer of their effects. This is the self that is produced by the formative forces, which is generated by the study of the treatises of the Lokayatas and so on.

original: thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis rnam par shes pa'i rgyun la brten par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa bdag tu rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin ni lhan cig skyes pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis rnam par shes pa'i rgyun la brten par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa bdag tu rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin ni lhan cig skyes pa ste /
translated: The self that is innate is the self that is conceived in the continuum of consciousness on the basis of the power of beginningless latent propensities of ignorance.

original: srog chags thams cad la thun mong du yod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: srog chags thams cad la thun mong du yod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yin no //
translated: This is the self that is common to all living beings and is that of ordinary beings.

original: de la phyogs dang po la re zhig bdag yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la re zhig bdag yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no //
translated: As for the first of these two alternatives, to begin with, there is no valid cognition that establishes the existence of the self.

original: mngon sum gyis ni bdag rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni bdag rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The self is not cognized by direct perception,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'i so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'i so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the objects of visual and other consciousnesses are determined to be individual things such as form.

original: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it cognized by inference,

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no evidence of effect or nature.

original: rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa yul dang dus su ldog pa dang bral ba'i bdag dang gzhan 'ga' zhig lhan cig 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ma grub pas 'bras bu'i rtags med pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa yul dang dus su ldog pa dang bral ba'i bdag dang gzhan 'ga' zhig lhan cig 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ma grub pas 'bras bu'i rtags med pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The evidence of effect is not established because the self is always hidden, and it is not established that it is something that goes with anything else, either in terms of place or time, and because the relationship of producer and produced is not established in terms of the self and anything else that goes with it.

original: chos can yod par ma grub pa'i phyir na rang bzhin gyis rtags mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can yod par ma grub pa'i phyir na rang bzhin gyis rtags mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the evidence of nature is not established because the existence of the subject is not established.

original: gang gi rjes su dpogs par 'gyur ba yod pa sgrub pa'i rtags gzhan yang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi rjes su dpogs par 'gyur ba yod pa sgrub pa'i rtags gzhan yang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is impossible for there to be any other evidence for the existence of the self, which is what is to be inferred.

original: rtags gzhan du gyur pa yang @34b bsgrub byas khyad par 'gyur dgos na bsgrub par bya ba bdag ni 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa nyid du gtan la ma phebs pas 'ga' yang des khyab par nges par mi nus pa'i phyir 'di la ni
analyzed: rtags gzhan du gyur pa yang @34b bsgrub byas khyad par 'gyur dgos na bsgrub par bya ba bdag ni 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa nyid du gtan la ma phebs pas 'ga' yang des khyab par nges par mi nus pa'i phyir 'di la ni
translated: And if the evidence were different from the probandum, the probandum would have to be qualified, but since the probandum, the self, is not established at all, it is not established as the pervader, and so it is not possible to ascertain that anything is pervaded by it.

original: rtags 'ga' zhig kyang 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: rtags 'ga' zhig kyang 'byung ba med do //
translated: So there is no evidence for it at all.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'am rjes su dpag pa sgrub byed ma yin mod /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'am rjes su dpag pa sgrub byed ma yin mod /
translated: The consciousnesses of the eye, etc., or inference are not the evidence for it.

original: nga zhes rtogs pa'i rang bzhin can bdag gi sgrub byed yin gyi mngon sum ni yod pa kho na snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: nga zhes rtogs pa'i rang bzhin can bdag gi sgrub byed yin gyi mngon sum ni yod pa kho na snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: But since it is suspected that the evidence for the self is the nature of the cognition ‚ÄúI,‚Äù which is a direct perception, he says:

original: nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ‚ÄúI‚Äù is not perceived, etc.

original: nga zhes bya ba rang rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa sems las gzhan pa bdag la sogs pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nga zhes bya ba rang rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa sems las gzhan pa bdag la sogs pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The self, which is the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù does not exist as anything other than the mind.

original: srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible.

original: ngar rtogs pa'i yul ni gzugs la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngar rtogs pa'i yul ni gzugs la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The object of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is form and so on.

original: nga skem pa nga sbom nga 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par nga'o snyam pa'i rtog pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: nga skem pa nga sbom nga 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par nga'o snyam pa'i rtog pa skye ba yin no //
translated: The conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù arises in the form of ‚ÄúI am thin,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am fat,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am walking,‚Äù and so on.

original: skem pa nyid dang sbom pa nyid de ni lus las gzhan du gyur pa'i chos ma yin no //
analyzed: skem pa nyid dang sbom pa nyid de ni lus las gzhan du gyur pa'i chos ma yin no //
translated: Thinness and fatness are not phenomena that are different from the body.

original: khyab dang lus can ma yin pa la ni lus can gyi rdzas kyi rjes su byed pa can 'gro ba'i bya ba yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab dang lus can ma yin pa la ni lus can gyi rdzas kyi rjes su byed pa can 'gro ba'i bya ba yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not tenable that that which is pervasive and not an embodied entity has the activity of going that conforms with an embodied entity.

original: de nas bdag sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas yod pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba las 'das pa dang / gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pas kyang 'di med pa kho nar 'thad do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas bdag sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas yod pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba las 'das pa dang / gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pas kyang 'di med pa kho nar 'thad do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Then, since there is no valid cognition to establish the self, it is beyond being suitable to be designated as existent, and since there is a valid cognition that refutes it, it is tenable that it is nonexistent alone.

original: bdag ces bya ba yod pa yin na rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nam 'on te rtogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin grang /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba yod pa yin na rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nam 'on te rtogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin grang /
translated: If the so-called self exists, is it by nature a cognizer or is it by nature a noncognizer?

original: de la phyogs dang po la ni mig la sogs pa 'bras bu med par thal ba bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la ni mig la sogs pa 'bras bu med par thal ba bzlog dka'o //
translated: In the first case, it is difficult to avoid the consequence that the eyes and so on would be pointless.

original: rtag tu gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag la ni mig la sogs pa rnams yod pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag la ni mig la sogs pa rnams yod pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: If the self is by nature always focused on form and so on, the eyes and so on would exist but would not have a point.

original: bdag rtogs pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin yang yod pa'i dngos po mi dmigs pas gnod do //
analyzed: bdag rtogs pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin yang yod pa'i dngos po mi dmigs pas gnod do //
translated: Even if the self is by nature noncognizant, it is undermined by the nonobservation of an existent thing.

original: des na 'di ni med pa kho nar 'thad do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: des na 'di ni med pa kho nar 'thad do zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore it is tenable that it is nonexistent alone.

original: yang 'jig tshogs su lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ni 'jig rten kun la ji ltar grub pa ji ltar bsnyon par nus snyam du dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni /üîΩnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'jig tshogs su lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ni 'jig rten kun la ji ltar grub pa ji ltar bsnyon par nus snyam du dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni / nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the innate view of the transitory collection is established for all worldly people. How could it be refuted?

original: dgos pa ni 'di yin te /üîΩji skad brjod pa'i tshul du @35a * //
analyzed: dgos pa ni 'di yin te / ji skad brjod pa'i tshul du @35a * //
translated: The purpose of this is as follows.

original: shes pa po dang / shes bya la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po thams cad med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa po dang / shes bya la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po thams cad med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since all things, such as the knower and the known, do not exist in the manner in which they are expressed,

original: nga zhes bya ba ngar 'dzin pa'i yul du gyur pa brtan pa dang / ngar 'dzin pa po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ji skad brjod pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems las gzhan pa ni 'ga' yang yod min te /
analyzed: nga zhes bya ba ngar 'dzin pa'i yul du gyur pa brtan pa dang / ngar 'dzin pa po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ji skad brjod pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems las gzhan pa ni 'ga' yang yod min te /
translated: there is no self, the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù which is the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù etc., that exists apart from the mind, which has the nature that has been expressed.

original: srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible.

original: des na bdag thams cad du med pa'i phyir na skra la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du bdag tu lta ba ni bden pa'i don can ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag thams cad du med pa'i phyir na skra la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du bdag tu lta ba ni bden pa'i don can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the self does not exist at all, the view of the self is not something that has a real object, like the cognition of hair, etc.

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa med pas srid pa dang dngos por yod pa'i phyir srid pa dang zhi ba'i dngos po rnams tha dad pa med pa bkag pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa med pas srid pa dang dngos por yod pa'i phyir srid pa dang zhi ba'i dngos po rnams tha dad pa med pa bkag pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since selflessness does not exist, existence and things exist, so existence and the things of peace are not refuted as undifferentiated and not nonexistent.

original: ji skad du brjod pa mi 'thad pa nyid 'chad par byed pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa mi 'thad pa nyid 'chad par byed pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement that explains the untenability of what was said is:üîΩBecause

original: gang phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of what?

original: gtan tshigs gang gi phyir kun rdzob pa byis pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i rang gi ngo bo ste de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin blo ldan ma 'khrul ba rnams kyis rtogs pa de nyid de dang rang rang de nyid de'i rang
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang gi phyir kun rdzob pa byis pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i rang gi ngo bo ste de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin blo ldan ma 'khrul ba rnams kyis rtogs pa de nyid de dang rang rang de nyid de'i rang
translated: The reason is this: The nature of the relative that is understood by the childish is its nature that is its reality, which is understood by the wise, the unmistaken ones. That is its nature.

original: bzhin no // des ni zhi ba dang srid pa'i rang bzhin thams cad tha dad pa med pa stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid kyis dbyer med par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: bzhin no // des ni zhi ba dang srid pa'i rang bzhin thams cad tha dad pa med pa stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid kyis dbyer med par rtog pa ste /
translated: That is its nature. Therefore, all the natures of peace and existence are undifferentiated, and they are conceived to be inseparable by virtue of being of one taste in emptiness.

original: tha dad pa med pa khong du chud pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad tha dad pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa khong du chud pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad tha dad pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because of the understanding of non-difference, all things are non-different.

original: thams cad kyi 'ga' med ces bya ba de nyid gsal bar byed pas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi 'ga' med ces bya ba de nyid gsal bar byed pas brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression ‚Äúnothing of anything‚Äù is clarified by the statement:

original: yul gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i yul gang zhig snang bar 'gyur ba rnams dang / ngar 'dzin pa'i yul 'dzin pa po'i rang bzhin gzhan gang yin pa 'ga' zhig rtog pa'i rten du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i yul gang zhig snang bar 'gyur ba rnams dang / ngar 'dzin pa'i yul 'dzin pa po'i rang bzhin gzhan gang yin pa 'ga' zhig rtog pa'i rten du gyur pa ste /
translated: Any object of form, etc., which appears as the objective domain of grasping, and any other nature of the subjective grasper, which is the basis of imagination,
