analyzed: gzhir gyur pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa po de dang de ni dbye ba ste so sor gyur cing bral bar gyur pa de dang bral ba'i phyir thams cad phan tshun dbyer med pa yin no //
translated: that object of grasping and subject of grasping are differentiated, i.e., are separate and disconnected. Because of the absence of that, all things are mutually undifferentiated.

original: des na thams cad min te thams cad ces bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na thams cad min te thams cad ces bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúnothing of anything‚Äù is the way things really are, i.e., nothing at all exists.

original: du ma nyid ni rtog pa las gyur pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: du ma nyid ni rtog pa las gyur pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The multiplicity is due to conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir de kho nar sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas ma yin pa mnyam pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams ni tha mi dad la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho nar sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas ma yin pa mnyam pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams ni tha mi dad la /
translated: Therefore, in reality, the Buddhas are undifferentiated, because the Buddhas and non-Buddhas are the same.

original: sems can rnams ni kun rdzob kho nar tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni kun rdzob kho nar tha dad pa yin no //
translated: And the sentient beings are differentiated only conventionally.

original: de ltar na @35b yang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa zhes gang brjod pa de 'thad pa nyid do zhes rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na @35b yang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa zhes gang brjod pa de 'thad pa nyid do zhes rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the statement, ‚Äúall beings are made perfect Buddhas‚Äù is tenable,

original: 'gro ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the world is pure by nature.

original: don dam pa goms pas ni rnam par rtog pa rnam par dag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa goms pas ni rnam par rtog pa rnam par dag par bya ba yin te /
translated: By cultivating the ultimate, the conceptualization is purified,

original: rtog pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dbye ba sgro 'dogs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dbye ba sgro 'dogs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: de bzhin du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa rang gi sngags de'i thig ler bcug pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par bsgom pa ni 'thad pa nyid do zhes shes par bya ste zhes bya ba
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa rang gi sngags de'i thig ler bcug pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par bsgom pa ni 'thad pa nyid do zhes shes par bya ste zhes bya ba
translated: Likewise, one should understand that it is reasonable to meditate on all beings who have become perfect buddhas as the nature of the ma·πá·∏çala wheel, placed in the bindu of one‚Äôs mantra.

original: la sogs pa med na rang gi snang ba de kho na de ltar skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa med na rang gi snang ba de kho na de ltar skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no such thing as ‚Äúand so on,‚Äù one‚Äôs own appearances arise in that way.

original: des na thams cad legs par gnas so //
analyzed: des na thams cad legs par gnas so //

original: 'dir zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa lam gyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems so //
analyzed: 'dir zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa lam gyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems so //
translated: Here, the mind is the reality of the path in the form of the mandala circle, which has the nature of the profound and the vast, the nature of means and insight.

original: snang ba med pa ni tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi mngon ba ste nyams su myong ba nyid tshad ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: snang ba med pa ni tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi mngon ba ste nyams su myong ba nyid tshad ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The absence of appearance is the non-manifestation of ordinary conceptualization, the meaning of which is that experience itself is valid cognition.

original: gal te bdag med pa'i shes pa ni bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba yin mod kyi bdag med pa nyid mi sgrub po zhes dgos pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa'i shes pa ni bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba yin mod kyi bdag med pa nyid mi sgrub po zhes dgos pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Someone might say, Although the consciousness of selflessness is indeed contradictory with the view of self, it does not establish selflessness.

original: yang dag rig pa las ni zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag rig pa las ni zhes pa ste /
translated: In response to this, it is said:üîΩFrom the perspective of reality,

original: kun rdzob kyi shes pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan bdag la sogs pa ci yang yod pa ma yin te /üîΩgzugs sogs rnam pa dag las nges grol ba //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi shes pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan bdag la sogs pa ci yang yod pa ma yin te / gzugs sogs rnam pa dag las nges grol ba //
translated: there is nothing at all, such as a self, apart from the consciousness of the relative.

original: zhes pa la sogs par sngar bsgrubs zin te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs par sngar bsgrubs zin te /
translated: As was previously established, such as in the line,üîΩFreed from aspects such as form,

original: ma lus pa mtha' bzhi las grol ba'i shes pa tsam mo zhes brjod zin to zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma lus pa mtha' bzhi las grol ba'i shes pa tsam mo zhes brjod zin to zhes pa'i don to //
translated: it is said that consciousness is merely freed from all four extremes.

original: 'o na gal te yang bdag tu lta ba dang bdag med par lta ba ni 'di ltar 'ga' zhig tu 'gal bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'o na gal te yang bdag tu lta ba dang bdag med par lta ba ni 'di ltar 'ga' zhig tu 'gal bar mthong ngo //
translated: Someone might say, Well, although the view of self and the view of selflessness are seen to be contradictory in some cases,

original: de lta mod kyi zhe sdang la sogs pa la byams pa la sogs pa bzhin du gtan nas ldog pa ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi zhe sdang la sogs pa la byams pa la sogs pa bzhin du gtan nas ldog pa ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In response to this doubt, he says, ‚ÄúThat which . . .‚Äù

original: gang zhig ste dngos po gang gis lan cig gi tshe yang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig ste dngos po gang gis lan cig gi tshe yang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: That which is the thing by which there is a contradiction at any time.

original: thams cad tshad mas nges par mthong ba goms pas 'phel ba rab tu song bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad tshad mas nges par mthong ba goms pas 'phel ba rab tu song bar gyur pa ste /
translated: All things are seen to be ascertained by valid cognition. Through the cultivation of that, they increase and become fully developed.

original: rab kyi mtha' thob pa na'o //
analyzed: rab kyi mtha' thob pa na'o //
translated: When they reach the highest point,

original: thod pa can gtsang sbra med par 'gyur ba bzhin du gtsang sbra la sogs par rang gi 'gal zla gtan nas 'gog pa de'i phyir bdag med par lta bas bdag tu lta ba gtan nas ldog par 'dod pa kho na'o zhes pa ni rig pa yin no //
analyzed: thod pa can gtsang sbra med par 'gyur ba bzhin du gtsang sbra la sogs par rang gi 'gal zla gtan nas 'gog pa de'i phyir bdag med par lta bas bdag tu lta ba gtan nas ldog par 'dod pa kho na'o zhes pa ni rig pa yin no //
translated: like a skull-garland wearer becoming pure, purity, etc., completely stop their opposites. Therefore, it is reasonable to assert that the view of selflessness completely stops the view of self.

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa thams cad kyang zhe sdang la sogs pa gtan nas ldog par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa thams cad kyang zhe sdang la sogs pa gtan nas ldog par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Love, etc., do not completely stop hatred, etc.

original: gnyi ga'i yang @44b rtsa ba 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbyams pa la sogs pas ni sdang ba la sogs pa'i dus su de srid kho nar sel ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i yang @44b rtsa ba 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin ba'i phyir ro // byams pa la sogs pas ni sdang ba la sogs pa'i dus su de srid kho nar sel ba yin te /
translated: because the root of both is the view of the perishable collection.üîΩBut love, etc., remove hatred, etc., only when they are present, just as fire, etc., produce burning, etc.,

original: me la sogs pas g-yo ba la sogs pa byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rigs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: me la sogs pas g-yo ba la sogs pa byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rigs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the argument.

original: gal te sdug bsngal mang po dang 'gal pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal mang po dang 'gal pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there a method for the removal of suffering, such as generosity, etc.?üîΩSo what is the use of the nature of the circle of deities?

original: des na dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin gyis ci zhig bya snyam du dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni tha mal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩso so'i skye bo tha mal pa'i bdag gi ste /
analyzed: des na dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin gyis ci zhig bya snyam du dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa ni tha mal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // so so'i skye bo tha mal pa'i bdag gi ste /
translated: The objection is anticipated and answered in the verse:üîΩThe generosity, etc., of ordinary people, who are ordinary by nature,

original: rang gi rang bzhin de dag gis byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni gal te yang don dam bdag med pa dang ldan pa de lta na yang srid pa'i sdug bsngal dang lhan cig tu 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin de dag gis byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni gal te yang don dam bdag med pa dang ldan pa de lta na yang srid pa'i sdug bsngal dang lhan cig tu 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: even though they are endowed with the ultimate selflessness, are not opposed to the suffering of existence.

original: gang gi sbyin pa la sogs pa 'di yod pa yin na yang tha mal ba'i bdag gi rang bzhin srid pa'i sdug bsngal de la log par ma gyur pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gang gi sbyin pa la sogs pa 'di yod pa yin na yang tha mal ba'i bdag gi rang bzhin srid pa'i sdug bsngal de la log par ma gyur pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Even though this generosity and so on exists, it is not the opposite of the suffering of existence that is the nature of the ordinary self.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: re zhig dmigs par lta bas byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyi srid pa'i sdug bsngal dang mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: re zhig dmigs par lta bas byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyi srid pa'i sdug bsngal dang mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
translated: Generosity and so on created by the view of the object is only not contradictory with the suffering of existence that is the nature of ordinary conceptualization.

original: bdag med pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa yang yongs su 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa yang yongs su 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: Generosity and so on endowed with the view of selflessness is also not completely contradictory.

original: der ni bdag med par lta ba ni dngos su 'gal ba yin pa des na de dang dngos su 'gal ba med pa'i phyir bskal ba mang pos thob par bya ba'i byang chub kyi dka' ba spyod pa'i tshogs kyi ngal ba pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul yang
analyzed: der ni bdag med par lta ba ni dngos su 'gal ba yin pa des na de dang dngos su 'gal ba med pa'i phyir bskal ba mang pos thob par bya ba'i byang chub kyi dka' ba spyod pa'i tshogs kyi ngal ba pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul yang
translated: There, the view of selflessness is directly contradictory. Therefore, since it is not directly contradictory with that, the hardship of the accumulation of the difficult conduct for enlightenment to be attained over many eons is not the method of the perfections.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshul mchog tu gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshul mchog tu gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: The method of perfect enlightenment is not supreme.

original: 'khor lo'i rnam pa can gyi sems 'di ni dngos su 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ldog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rnam pa can gyi sems 'di ni dngos su 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ldog par byed pa'o //
translated: This mind, which is of the nature of a wheel, directly turns away from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: dam pa'i bden pa thabs bde ba mdor bsdus nas byed pa'i phyir na dam pa rnams kyi lam gyi bden pa de nyid bstan par bya ba yin no //üîΩyang na rang bzhin las byung bdag rang gis //
analyzed: dam pa'i bden pa thabs bde ba mdor bsdus nas byed pa'i phyir na dam pa rnams kyi lam gyi bden pa de nyid bstan par bya ba yin no // yang na rang bzhin las byung bdag rang gis //
translated: Because it is the means for the happiness of the truth of the highest, the truth of the path of the holy ones is to be taught.üîΩOr, it is the generosity, etc.

original: byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs bdag med dang // ldan yang 'gal ba ma yin gang gi phyir //
analyzed: byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs bdag med dang // ldan yang 'gal ba ma yin gang gi phyir //
translated: that arises from the nature, which is not contradictory, even though it is devoid of self.

original: 'di yod na yang de yod ma gyur phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di yod na yang de yod ma gyur phyir // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because, even when this exists, that does not exist.

original: rang bzhin las byung ba ni rang bzhin las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin las byung ba ni rang bzhin las byung ba'o //
translated: Arisen from the nature means arisen from the nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gi ste sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin @45a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gi ste sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin @45a * //
translated: Therefore, it is one‚Äôs own, that is, the nature of the mind, which is the nature of emptiness, etc.

original: yin pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rang gi mtshan nyid mang ba'i phyir mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: yin pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rang gi mtshan nyid mang ba'i phyir mang po'i tshig go //
translated: The result of generosity, etc. is manifold, because of the multiplicity of its characteristics. Therefore, the word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is used.

original: de dag gis bcug pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa yang lha'i 'khor lo'i rnam pa can gyi sems dang lhan cig 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis bcug pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa yang lha'i 'khor lo'i rnam pa can gyi sems dang lhan cig 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: Also, the generosity and so forth that are placed by them are not contradictory with the mind that has the form of the circle of deities.

original: bdag med pa nyid yin pas na 'gal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni gang gi phyir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa can thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad bdag med pa'i sems nyid yod na yang sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs de log par
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid yin pas na 'gal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni gang gi phyir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa can thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad bdag med pa'i sems nyid yod na yang sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs de log par
translated: Since they are just selflessness, they are not contradictory. This is the meaning.

original: ma gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is clarified: because of the existence of just the mind of the selflessness of all phenomena, which has the nature of the union of method and wisdom that has the form of the circle of deities, the observances of generosity, morality, and so forth are not perverted.

original: da ni rtser ldan su zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas mjug bsdu bar byed do //
analyzed: da ni rtser ldan su zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas mjug bsdu bar byed do //
translated: Now, he concludes with ‚ÄúWho is endowed with the peak?‚Äù and so forth.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i don de ltar rtogs nas ji skad du brjod pa'i sems sdud pas yid la rab tu bsgrub pa'i grub par bya ba'i byung zin pa'i bstan pa ni 'di 'bad pa med par sgrub par byed pa yin par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i don de ltar rtogs nas ji skad du brjod pa'i sems sdud pas yid la rab tu bsgrub pa'i grub par bya ba'i byung zin pa'i bstan pa ni 'di 'bad pa med par sgrub par byed pa yin par rtogs par byed do //
translated: Having understood the meaning just explained, one should realize that the teaching of the past, present, and future Buddhas is accomplished without effort by the mental practice of the mind described above.

original: myur du tshegs med par grub par byed nus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: myur du tshegs med par grub par byed nus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is able to accomplish quickly and without difficulty.

original: de nyid sems can thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid sems can thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: It is inconceivable because it is not the object of all sentient beings.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ma lus pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: It is glorious because it is the basis of all one's own aims.

original: kun du ma lus par bzang po ste dge legs 'di las byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pas kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: kun du ma lus par bzang po ste dge legs 'di las byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pas kun du bzang po'o //
translated: It is Samantabhadra, the basis of the aims of others, because all good, all that is excellent, arises from it.

original: thams cad rang gi snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis na rang bzhin rtser ldan skye bo la phan par 'dod pa su zhing sgom par mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi bzod pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad rang gi snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis na rang bzhin rtser ldan skye bo la phan par 'dod pa su zhing sgom par mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi bzod pa ste /
translated: Since everything is just one's own appearance, who, having the nature of the peak, would not practice the meditation that is desired for the benefit of beings? The word indeed is an expression of intolerance.

original: gang phyir blo dang ldan pas mi bsgom pa ji ltar zhes pa 'di ni mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir blo dang ldan pas mi bsgom pa ji ltar zhes pa 'di ni mi bzod pa'o //
translated: How is it that the wise do not meditate? This is intolerance.

original: da ni slob dpon bdag nyid kheng skyung bar bzhed nas blo gros dri med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni slob dpon bdag nyid kheng skyung bar bzhed nas blo gros dri med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the master himself, wishing to humble himself, says with stainless intelligence, etc.

original: blo gros dri med nyid 'od yin te /
analyzed: blo gros dri med nyid 'od yin te /
translated: Stainless intelligence itself is light.

original: de rmongs pa'i mun pa mtha' dag bsal ba'i chen po rnams kyis rnam par bkod par nus shing rung ba 'jam pa'i rdo rje sgrub pa'i thabs 'dir bdag 'dra ba'i go skabs gal yod /
analyzed: de rmongs pa'i mun pa mtha' dag bsal ba'i chen po rnams kyis rnam par bkod par nus shing rung ba 'jam pa'i rdo rje sgrub pa'i thabs 'dir bdag 'dra ba'i go skabs gal yod /
translated: It is possible and suitable for those of great stainless intelligence to arrange this method of accomplishing Manjusri, who has dispelled all the darkness of delusion.üîΩIn this, there is no opportunity for one like me.

original: de lta mod kyis 'on kyang gang gi phyir te rgyu gang gis skye bo bla mar gyur pa ni bla ma'i skye bo ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyis 'on kyang gang gi phyir te rgyu gang gis skye bo bla mar gyur pa ni bla ma'i skye bo ste /
translated: Nevertheless, however, for what reason, by what cause, the people who are gurus, the people who are teachers,

original: de bzhes pa cung zad zin cing len pa sgrub thabs su byas @45b shing bkod pa des thog mar te /
analyzed: de bzhes pa cung zad zin cing len pa sgrub thabs su byas @45b shing bkod pa des thog mar te /
translated: Having accepted it, he partook of it a little, and by the performance and arrangement of the rite, he first,

original: dang po srid par shin tu dam par bcings pa lhod par byed ces grags pa de'i phyir na sgrub thabs byed ba'i 'grel pa 'di byas kyis /
analyzed: dang po srid par shin tu dam par bcings pa lhod par byed ces grags pa de'i phyir na sgrub thabs byed ba'i 'grel pa 'di byas kyis /
translated: at the beginning, loosened the very tight binding in existence. Because of that, he made this commentary on the rite.

original: bdag nyid bdag nyid chen po ston par byed 'dod pas byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag nyid chen po ston par byed 'dod pas byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: It is not that he made it desiring to teach himself. This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: da ni sgrub thabs bkod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba gsung pa ni 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs 'di bkod pa las byung ba'i dge ba dri ma med pa gang yin pa des ni 'gro ba rnams kyi yid kyis sangs
analyzed: da ni sgrub thabs bkod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba gsung pa ni 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs 'di bkod pa las byung ba'i dge ba dri ma med pa gang yin pa des ni 'gro ba rnams kyi yid kyis sangs
translated: Now, he says the dedication of the merit arising from the arrangement of the rite: Whatever stainless virtue there is from the arrangement of this rite called this, by that, may the minds of beings

original: rgyas kyi ye shes kyi mgon dang bcas shing der gzhol zhing der phyogs pa'i rang bzhin rang gi lha'i 'khor lo rtag tu bsgom par shog cig pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas kyi ye shes kyi mgon dang bcas shing der gzhol zhing der phyogs pa'i rang bzhin rang gi lha'i 'khor lo rtag tu bsgom par shog cig pa'o //
translated: always meditate on the wheel of their own deity, which has the nature of being inclined toward and directed toward the wisdom of the Buddhas, along with the protector.

analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa'i sgrub thabs kyi rgya cher bshad pa snying po snye ma zhes bya ba slob dpon dpal kun du bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The extensive explanation of the four-branched sƒÅdhana called The Essence Necklace composed by the master ≈örƒ´ Samantabhadra is complete.

analyzed: // / pandi ta chen po nya ya na shr'i dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba chen po sh'akya'i dge slong blo ldan shes rab kyis bal yul mthil du bsgyur ba'o//
